definitions: To pierce or fasten with a spike or spikes.
To add alcohol or a drug to a drink or food surreptitiously.
To hit (a ball) forcefully downwards over the net in volleyball.
To prevent (a gun) from being fired by driving a spike into the touch hole.
examples: The team managed to spike the ball for a point.
Prices are expected to spike next month.
Someone spiked her drink at the party.
He spiked the documents to the bulletin board.
The soldiers decided to spike the enemy's cannons.
